wikipedia_page.main:
Tom Finney

Andrew McLaren (24 January 1922 – 14 December 1996) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as an inside forward. He was on the books of a number of teams in The Football League. He started as a youth player at Deepdale in 1937, serving on the ground staff with Tom Finney and playing with him in the B team. He played for Preston in the wartime cup in 1940–41 when they won the league and cup. He served in the army during the war, with some service in Egypt. In 1947 he played in four international matches for Scotland, scoring four goals. He was tragically found dead alone at his home in Chorley. Police believed that he had been dead for some days before his body was discovered. He was estranged from his wife at the time of his death.
